in_end = in_start + n_input
out_end = in_end + n_out
# ensure we have enough data for this instance
if out_end < len(data):
X.append(data[in_start:in_end, :])
y.append(data[in_end:out_end, 0])
# move along one time step
in_start += 1
return array(X), array(y)
